meanings.sent1: The gasses in the balloons made them float.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the different gasses in the atmosphere.
meanings.sent3: The clown accidentally inhaled helium gasses and started talking funny.
meanings.sent4: The gasses of excitement filled the room as the surprise was revealed.
meanings.sent5: The foul gasses from the swamp made it hard to breathe.

meanings.definition: Third person singular present of gas
meanings.sent1: He gasses up his car before a long road trip.
meanings.sent2: The chef gasses the kitchen to ensure a clean cooking environment.
meanings.sent3: The skunk gasses the area when it feels threatened.
meanings.sent4: The comedian gasses the audience with laughter during the show.
meanings.sent5: The farmer gasses the field to protect the crops from pests.
